componenttext: Your next question will be coming from the line of Budd Bugatch with Raymond James.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: A lot of my questions have been answered, but you used to disclose the average wage per hour in the U.S., and obviously, with a lot of the moving parts and the wage increases, can you disclose that number anymore, what that average is in the U.S?
componenttext: A lot of my questions have been answered, but you used to disclose the average wage per hour in the U.S., and obviously, with a lot of the moving parts and the wage increases, can you disclose that number anymore, what that average is in the U.S?

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes, I mean, the starting wages is, as you know, it's $11 an hour and the average, I think, is $13.50, somewhere around there for U.S. stores and of course DCs will be higher than that.
componenttext: Yes, I mean, the starting wages is, as you know, it's $11 an hour and the average, I think, is $13.50, somewhere around there for U.S. stores and of course DCs will be higher than that.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Okay. And my follow-up is -- relates to some of the pretty sophisticated applications you have in the stores both in Walmart U.S. and in Sam's. When I'm in the stores and use Walmart Pay, I always ask the people at the register if people use it, and I get
componenttext: Okay. And my follow-up is -- relates to some of the pretty sophisticated applications you have in the stores both in Walmart U.S. and in Sam's. When I'm in the stores and use Walmart Pay, I always ask the people at the register if people use it, and I get very, very rare usage of things like Walmart Pay. Can you talk about the usage of Walmart Pay? And maybe even Scan & Go in Sam's? And maybe what kind of increases you've seen in the penetration of the usage of those apps?

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: So Scan & Go has been a really popular app, actually, at Sam's Club. I spoke a little bit to how we think it's impacting our traffic numbers and ticket numbers, great response from customers on that. And so we're really pleased with the ramp-up in Scan &
componenttext: So Scan & Go has been a really popular app, actually, at Sam's Club. I spoke a little bit to how we think it's impacting our traffic numbers and ticket numbers, great response from customers on that. And so we're really pleased with the ramp-up in Scan & Go. In terms of Walmart Pay in the Walmart stores, that is also growing, but we haven't broken out the specific stats around it.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: These are all just areas, Budd, of increasing the level of convenience for a customer, and as they choose to shop with us, they have a choice in how they do that. And so as Dan mentioned, we're pleased with the Walmart Pay trends and we would only expect
componenttext: These are all just areas, Budd, of increasing the level of convenience for a customer, and as they choose to shop with us, they have a choice in how they do that. And so as Dan mentioned, we're pleased with the Walmart Pay trends and we would only expect that to grow.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: I certainly hope so, Kary, because I really look for it when I'm in the stores and I'm in the stores for fair amount, and I just don't see a reasonably decent usage of it. So, would love to see...
componenttext: I certainly hope so, Kary, because I really look for it when I'm in the stores and I'm in the stores for fair amount, and I just don't see a reasonably decent usage of it. So, would love to see...

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: It's incredibly easy to use. So I think as customers -- as there continues to be more communications around it and signage and advertising and so forth, yes, I think once you convert a customer to Walmart Pay, they really like it.  It makes it very simple
componenttext: It's incredibly easy to use. So I think as customers -- as there continues to be more communications around it and signage and advertising and so forth, yes, I think once you convert a customer to Walmart Pay, they really like it.  It makes it very simple.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: I think there's also...
componenttext: I think there's also...

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: I agree with that.
componenttext: I agree with that.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: I'd also think that as we add more features to the app and draw more people to download the app, that should help our adoption rates of Walmart Pay.
componenttext: I'd also think that as we add more features to the app and draw more people to download the app, that should help our adoption rates of Walmart Pay.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: The next question comes from the line of Joseph Feldman with Telsey Advisory Group.
componenttext: The next question comes from the line of Joseph Feldman with Telsey Advisory Group.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: I have a couple of quick ones. With Sam's Club, the traffic was up a lot, and I know some of it may be just the transfer from the stores that were closed, but is there anything else driving that big 6.2% traffic number?
componenttext: I have a couple of quick ones. With Sam's Club, the traffic was up a lot, and I know some of it may be just the transfer from the stores that were closed, but is there anything else driving that big 6.2% traffic number?

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: So the traffic, as I mentioned earlier, there's a lot of pieces that go into that, but closed Clubs obviously is significant this quarter until we lap that event. But we're also getting more frequent visits with the Scan & Go, people. Just the behavior of
componenttext: So the traffic, as I mentioned earlier, there's a lot of pieces that go into that, but closed Clubs obviously is significant this quarter until we lap that event. But we're also getting more frequent visits with the Scan & Go, people. Just the behavior of the member changes there. So that would probably be the other big callout that I would make.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Got it. And then one other one was with Sears going away or -- and sort of, it may sound unrelated, but like even the wildfires, like those kind of exogenous pressures or factors, are you seeing any impact from them? Or maybe transfer sales or things that
componenttext: Got it. And then one other one was with Sears going away or -- and sort of, it may sound unrelated, but like even the wildfires, like those kind of exogenous pressures or factors, are you seeing any impact from them? Or maybe transfer sales or things that you're doing to help in the -- like the wildfire community, so kind of a 2-part question there.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: No, I haven't seen anything specific on -- as it relates to the fires, I mean, it's one small part of the country. We obviously have our store base. It would have to be pretty monumental to have a major effect. Not, that's not a monumental event. It's obv
componenttext: No, I haven't seen anything specific on -- as it relates to the fires, I mean, it's one small part of the country. We obviously have our store base. It would have to be pretty monumental to have a major effect. Not, that's not a monumental event. It's obviously terrible, but there's nothing specific that I would speak to on that today. I think the other part of your question was around Sears, but there's a lot of retailers out there that are struggling and we pay less attention to what they're doing a lot more and what we're doing and what we can control, and market share is going to flow. Obviously, the big focus for us in the near term is in the toy business just given what's happened in the retail landscape in that particular category, but we're in the market every day, every week, every month getting better. It's getting better on price, it's getting better on private brand, getting better on assortments on store level, shopability, experience of the customers. So as long as we're doing those things, I think we're going to be able to take share from a lot -- in a lot of different places.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: The next question is from the line of Scot Ciccarelli with RBC Capital Markets.
componenttext: The next question is from the line of Scot Ciccarelli with RBC Capital Markets.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Dan, earlier in the call, I think you mentioned some of the drivers to your average ticket growth and you seemed to highlight both eCommerce penetration as well as fresh. Are there any other big contributors to the average ticket you've experienced -- inc
componenttext: Dan, earlier in the call, I think you mentioned some of the drivers to your average ticket growth and you seemed to highlight both eCommerce penetration as well as fresh. Are there any other big contributors to the average ticket you've experienced -- increase you've experienced in the last few quarters? Or are those 2 factors really about the lion's share?

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: We've seen some good general merchandise growth last quarter. As you recall, we had some seasonal benefits that we've got from the way the weather broke. And certainly, this quarter, we've seen really good strength in the apparel business, the toy busines
componenttext: We've seen some good general merchandise growth last quarter. As you recall, we had some seasonal benefits that we've got from the way the weather broke. And certainly, this quarter, we've seen really good strength in the apparel business, the toy business, automotive, so these tend to be higher ticket categories, and I think that mix of business has helped us as well.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Got you. And when you look at your eCommerce contribution, the 140 basis points that you highlighted, does that have a bigger impact on traffic or ticket?
componenttext: Got you. And when you look at your eCommerce contribution, the 140 basis points that you highlighted, does that have a bigger impact on traffic or ticket?

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Traffic, but ticket as well because you're getting a higher ticket on eCommerce. So I wouldn't necessarily try and break that out here today.
componenttext: Traffic, but ticket as well because you're getting a higher ticket on eCommerce. So I wouldn't necessarily try and break that out here today.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Ben Bienvenu with Stephens.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Ben Bienvenu with Stephens.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: I wanted to ask about the receivables. How much of that decline year-over-year is being driven by Brazil? And how much of it is sustainable as we lap over that? Should we expect receivables to begin growing again as we move out of 2019?
componenttext: I wanted to ask about the receivables. How much of that decline year-over-year is being driven by Brazil? And how much of it is sustainable as we lap over that? Should we expect receivables to begin growing again as we move out of 2019?

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Certainly, Brazil and Flipkart play a role in that as well as FX. So we don't break out the specifics, but those are the 3 pieces that have had an impact. Flipkart is adding; Brazil, detracting; FX, detracting, but there's nothing -- when I look at the un
componenttext: Certainly, Brazil and Flipkart play a role in that as well as FX. So we don't break out the specifics, but those are the 3 pieces that have had an impact. Flipkart is adding; Brazil, detracting; FX, detracting, but there's nothing -- when I look at the underlying numbers, there's nothing unusual or concerning.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then on the International inventory, for the last several quarters, you guys have grown -- have been growing inventory at a slower rate than sales. You had partial contribution of sales from Flipkart this quarter. Is it reasonable to assume that
componenttext: Okay. And then on the International inventory, for the last several quarters, you guys have grown -- have been growing inventory at a slower rate than sales. You had partial contribution of sales from Flipkart this quarter. Is it reasonable to assume that with a full quarter's contribution of Flipkart sales that, that trends you've seen in the past should sustain inventory growing at a slower rate than sales?

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: So yes, inventory, obviously, being a snapshot in time as relative to our sales would be a little bit out of line or misaligned. So yes, the next quarter, you should start to see more normal trends, but we don't predict specifically or forecast inventory
componenttext: So yes, inventory, obviously, being a snapshot in time as relative to our sales would be a little bit out of line or misaligned. So yes, the next quarter, you should start to see more normal trends, but we don't predict specifically or forecast inventory levels for the business overall, never mind international. You can -- it's safe to say that inventory is, it's a focus around the globe. We've made good progress as a company, so I'll just leave that as a takeaway.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: And FX has an impact on that line as well. So...
componenttext: And FX has an impact on that line as well. So...

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: The next question is from the line of Rupesh Parikh with Oppenheimer.
componenttext: The next question is from the line of Rupesh Parikh with Oppenheimer.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: So on your free shipping threshold, so clearly Amazon recently removed it for the holiday season. So I was just curious how you guys feel about your -- the competitiveness of your offering in light of their actions?
componenttext: So on your free shipping threshold, so clearly Amazon recently removed it for the holiday season. So I was just curious how you guys feel about your -- the competitiveness of your offering in light of their actions?

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Sure. So we feel good about the offering. We feel good about our price points. We feel good about our price gaps on the full basket and there's nothing to announce today on shipping.
componenttext: Sure. So we feel good about the offering. We feel good about our price points. We feel good about our price gaps on the full basket and there's nothing to announce today on shipping.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Okay, great. And then there wasn't commentary this quarter on the consumer electronics category. So I was curious how that performed for the Walmart U.S. segment.
componenttext: Okay, great. And then there wasn't commentary this quarter on the consumer electronics category. So I was curious how that performed for the Walmart U.S. segment.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: We had broad-based strength in general merchandise. I mean, electronics didn't pop up at the top of the list this quarter, but we did see strength in areas like mobile, for example. We're pleased with the TV business. We've certainly seen -- we've moved w
componenttext: We had broad-based strength in general merchandise. I mean, electronics didn't pop up at the top of the list this quarter, but we did see strength in areas like mobile, for example. We're pleased with the TV business. We've certainly seen -- we've moved with the market, shifting towards larger screen sizes. We've gotten better assorted in connected home, so we feel pretty good about the direction of that business both from a merchandising perspective and sales perspective overall.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes, gaming had a good quarter as well and we showed off some of the new innovation we have there with the arcade games. You might have seen them in October when you were here. That, amongst a number of other new offerings, are really driving that busines
componenttext: Yes, gaming had a good quarter as well and we showed off some of the new innovation we have there with the arcade games. You might have seen them in October when you were here. That, amongst a number of other new offerings, are really driving that business. Pleased with that.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Our final question today comes from the line of Mark Astrachan with Stifel.
componenttext: Our final question today comes from the line of Mark Astrachan with Stifel.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: I wanted to go back to traffic in the U.S. and try to understand how it flowed through from the U.S. grocery standpoint. So I think it was roughly constant and overall grocery comp was even at the high end of low single digits. Is it fair to assume there
componenttext: I wanted to go back to traffic in the U.S. and try to understand how it flowed through from the U.S. grocery standpoint. So I think it was roughly constant and overall grocery comp was even at the high end of low single digits. Is it fair to assume there was some moderation in traffic sequentially in terms of contribution to comp?

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Traffic moderated largely because of the comparison to last year's hurricanes. We had hurricanes this quarter, but not as significant as last quarter -- last year. But overall, we are pleased with what we are seeing in the broader traffic trends. And if y
componenttext: Traffic moderated largely because of the comparison to last year's hurricanes. We had hurricanes this quarter, but not as significant as last quarter -- last year. But overall, we are pleased with what we are seeing in the broader traffic trends. And if you look at the 2-year stacks on traffic over the last few quarters, you can see, really, over the last, actually 4 to 8 quarters, you can see a nice progression, and I would say, on a 2-year stack basis, there was nothing -- we were pleased with what we saw.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Okay. One last housekeeping question. So on interest expense, debt balance up in the quarter. Is there anything exceptional we should know in trying to model that from a floating versus fixed rate standpoint?
componenttext: Okay. One last housekeeping question. So on interest expense, debt balance up in the quarter. Is there anything exceptional we should know in trying to model that from a floating versus fixed rate standpoint?

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: So we do have some lower interest rate debt that helps. And we had the Flipkart piece in there, and I think there may have been -- is there any other factors? I'm just trying to think.
componenttext: So we do have some lower interest rate debt that helps. And we had the Flipkart piece in there, and I think there may have been -- is there any other factors? I'm just trying to think.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: These are the main ones.
componenttext: These are the main ones.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: I will hand the floor back to management for closing remarks.
componenttext: I will hand the floor back to management for closing remarks.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018
componenttextpreview: Great. Well, we appreciate the time. We went a little bit over. I just wanted to make sure we fit everybody in. In closing, we are really pleased with the Q3 results. We have good momentum in the business. We feel good about our competitive position heade
componenttext: Great. Well, we appreciate the time. We went a little bit over. I just wanted to make sure we fit everybody in. In closing, we are really pleased with the Q3 results. We have good momentum in the business. We feel good about our competitive position headed into the holiday season, and we are positioned to win. The IR team here at Walmart, along with our executives, wish you all a happy and safe holiday season, and have a great day. Thanks.

headline: Walmart Inc., Q3 2019 Pre Recorded Earnings Call, Nov 15, 2018

componenttext: This concludes today's conference. You may disconnect your lines at this time. Thank you for your participation.
